analyzed: na itti
translated: The Guide

analyzed: paṭiniddesa vāra
translated: The Reversal Section

analyzed: vibhaṅga
translated: The Analysis

analyzed: o taraṇa hāra vibhaṅga
translated: The Analysis of the Mode of Conveying a Conversion

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāro
translated: Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying a Conversion?

analyzed: yaḥ ca paṭiccuppādaḥ ti
translated: “ And what is the origination of the world? “

analyzed: uddham adhas sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ
translated: “ Above, below, around, free,

analyzed: ayam aham asmi iti anānupassī
translated: Not contemplating ‘ I am this ‘,

analyzed: evam vimuttaḥ udatāri ogha
translated: Thus liberated, he has crossed over the flood

analyzed: a tiṇṇa pubbam apunabbhavāya ati
translated: Not crossed before, to the state beyond birth “ .

analyzed: uddhanti rūpadhātu ca arūpadhātu ca
translated: “ Above “ is the form-element and the formless element.

analyzed: adha uti kāmadhātu
translated: “ Below “ is the sense-desire element.

analyzed: sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ ti tedhātuke ayam asekkhā vimutti
translated: “ Free “ is the non-learner’s deliverance in the three elements.

original: Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni, ayaṁ indriyehi otaraṇā.
analyzed: asekkhāni pañca indriyāni ayam indriyehi
translated: Those same five non-learner faculties are the faculties. This is the conversion by means of the faculties.

original: Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni vijjā, vijjuppādā avijjānirodho, avijjānirodhā saṅkhāranirodho,
analyzed: tāni yeva asekkhāni pañca indriyāni vijjā vijjuppādā avijjā nirodhaḥ avijjā nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodhaḥ
translated: Those same five non-learner faculties are the three true knowledges. With the arising of the three true knowledges there is the cessation of ignorance. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of determinations.

original: saṅkhāranirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho, nāmarūpanirodhā saḷāyatananirodho,
analyzed: saṅkhāra nirodhā viññāṇa nirodhaḥ viññāṇa nirodhā nāma rūpa nirodhaḥ nāma rūpa nirodhā saḷāyatana nirodho
translated: With the cessation of determinations there is the cessation of consciousness. With the cessation of consciousness there is the cessation of name-and-form. With the cessation of name-and-form there is the cessation of the sixfold base.

original: saḷāyatananirodhā phassanirodho, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho,
analyzed: saḷāyatana nirodhā phassa nirodho phassa nirodhā vedanā nirodhaḥ vedanā nirodhā taṇhā nirodho
translated: With the cessation of the sixfold base there is the cessation of contact. With the cessation of contact there is the cessation of feeling. With the cessation of feeling there is the cessation of craving.

original: taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho,
analyzed: taṇhā nirodhāḥ upādāna nirodhaḥ upādāna nirodhāḥ bhava nirodhaḥ bhava nirodhāḥ jāti nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of craving there is the cessation of clinging. With the cessation of clinging there is the cessation of existence. With the cessation of existence there is the cessation of birth.

analyzed: jāti nirodhā jarā maraṇam soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ nirujjhanti
translated: With the cessation of birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair all cease.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodhaḥ hoti
translated: This is the cessation of the whole mass of suffering.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the entry into conditionality.

original: Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahitāni—
analyzed: tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahitāni
translated: Those same five noble faculties are included in three aggregates:

original: sīlakkhandhena samādhikkhandhena paññākkhandhena, ayaṁ khandhehi otaraṇā.
analyzed: sīla kkhandhena samādhi kkhandhena paññā kkhandhena ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: the virtue aggregate, the concentration aggregate, and the wisdom aggregate. This is the entry into the aggregates.

original: Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni saṅkhārapariyāpannāni ye saṅkhārā anāsavā, no ca bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: tāni yeva asekkhāni pañca indriyāni saṅkhāra pariyāpannāni ye saṅkhārāḥ anāsavāḥ no ca bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: Those same five noble faculties are included in the formations category, which is the formations that are without pollutants but are not the life-faculty. They are included in the mental-data element.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the entry into the elements.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ anāsavaṁ, no ca bhavaṅgaṁ.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam anāsava no ca
translated: That mental-data element is included in the mental-data sense-sphere, which is the sense-sphere that is without pollutants but is not the life-faculty.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the entry into the sense-spheres.

original: “Ayaṁ ahasmīti anānupassī”ti ayaṁ sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā samugghāto, sā sekkhāvimutti, tāniyeva sekkhāni pañcindriyāni.🔽Ayaṁ indriyehi otaraṇā.
analyzed: ayam aha asmi iti anānupassī iti ayam sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā samugghāto sā sekkhā vimutti tāni yeva sekkhāni pañca indriyāni  ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: “He does not see any self at all” is the uprooting of personality view. That is the emancipation of the trainer. Those same five faculties of the trainer.🔽This is the entry into the faculties.

original: Tāniyeva sekkhāni pañcindriyāni vijjā, vijjuppādā avijjānirodho, avijjānirodhā saṅkhāranirodho, evaṁ sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo.
analyzed: tāni yeva sekkhāni pañca indriyāni vijjā vijjuppādā avijjā nirodhaḥ avijjā nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodho evam sabbaḥ paṭiccasamuppādo
translated: “He is not contemplating ‘I am this’” is the uprooting of personality view. That is the emancipation of the trainer. Those same five faculties of the trainer are knowledge. With the arising of knowledge there is the cessation of ignorance. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of volitional formations. Thus the whole process of conditionality.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration by way of conditionality.

analyzed: sāya iva vijjā paññākkhandho
translated: That same knowledge is the category of understanding.

analyzed: ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration by way of the categories.

original: Sāyeva vijjā saṅkhārapariyāpannā, ye saṅkhārā anāsavā, no ca bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā, ayaṁ dhātūhi otaraṇā.
analyzed: sāyā iva vijjā saṅkhāra pariyāpannā ye saṅkhārāḥ anāsavāḥ no ca bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitāḥ ayam dhātūhi otaraṇā
translated: That same knowledge is included in formations. Those formations that are free from cankers, but are not the life-continuum, are included in the element of mental data. This is the penetration by way of the elements.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ anāsavaṁ, no ca bhavaṅgaṁ, ayaṁ āyatanehi otaraṇā.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam anāsava no ca āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: That element of mental data is included in the mental-data base. That base is free from cankers, but is not the life-continuum. This is the penetration by way of the bases.

original: Sekkhāya ca vimuttiyā asekkhāya ca vimuttiyā vimutto udatāri oghaṁ atiṇṇapubbaṁ apunabbhavāya.
analyzed: sekkhāya ca vimuttiyā asekkhāya ca vimuttiyā vimuttaḥ udatāri ogham a tiṇṇa pubbam a punabbhavāya
translated: By means of the emancipation of the trainer and the emancipation of the non-trainer, he has crossed the flood that is to be crossed without remainder, which had not been crossed in the past and will not be crossed again.

original: Tenāha bhagavā “uddhaṁ adho”ti.🔽“Nissitassa calitaṁ, anissitassa calitaṁ natthi, calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā🔽sati nati na hoti, natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti, āgatigatiyā asati cutūpapāto na
analyzed: tena āha bhagavān uddham adha iti  nissitassa calita anissitassa calitam natthi calite asati passaddhi passaddhiyā  sati nati na hoti natiyāḥ asati āgati gati na hoti āgati gatiyāḥ asati cutūpapātaḥ na
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Above, below, around, and all that is, is free from the six bases of sense and from the six pretend bases.

original: hoti, cutūpapāte asati nevidha na huraṁ na ubhayamantarena esevanto dukkhassā”ti.
analyzed: hoti cutūpapāte asati na huram na ubhayam antarena esevantaḥ dukkhassa ti
translated: “For one who is dependent there is wavering; for one who is independent there is no wavering. When there is no wavering, there is tranquillity. When there is tranquillity, there is no leaning. When there is no leaning, there is no coming and going. When there is no coming and going, there is no passing away and arising. When there is no passing away and arising, there is no fading away and cessation. Such is the end of this whole mass of suffering.

original: “Nissitassa calitan”ti nissayo nāma duvidho taṇhānissayo ca diṭṭhinissayo ca.
analyzed: nissitassa calitanti nissayaḥ nāma duvidho taṇhā nissayo ca diṭṭhi nissayo ca
translated: “For one who is dependent there is wavering”: dependence is of two kinds, dependence through craving and dependence through views.

original: Tattha yā rattassa cetanā, ayaṁ taṇhānissayo;
analyzed: tattha yā rattassa cetanā ayam taṇhā nissayo
translated: Herein, the volition of one who is dull is dependence through craving;

analyzed: yā mūḷhassa cetanā ayam diṭṭhi nissayo
translated: the volition of one who is confused is dependence through views.

original: Cetanā pana saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṁ, evaṁ sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo.
analyzed: cetanā pana saṅkhārā saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpa evam sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo
translated: But volition is formations, and with formations as condition there is consciousness, and with consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality, and so on. This is the whole dependent origination.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the entry into the dependent origination.

original: Tattha yā rattassa vedanā, ayaṁ sukhā vedanā.
analyzed: tattha yā rattassa vedanā ayam sukhā vedanā
translated: Herein, the feeling of one who is dull is pleasant feeling.

original: Yā sammūḷhassa vedanā, ayaṁ adukkhamasukhā vedanā, imā dve vedanā vedanākkhandho.
analyzed: yā sammūḷhassa vedanā ayam adukkham asukhā vedanā imāḥ dve vedanāḥ vedanā khandho
translated: The feeling of one who is confused is neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. These two feelings are the feeling aggregate.

analyzed: ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration by way of the aggregates.

original: Tattha sukhā vedanā dve indriyāni sukhindriyaṁ somanassindriyañca, adukkhamasukhā vedanā upekkhindriyaṁ.
analyzed: tattha sukhā vedanā dve indriyāni sukha indriyam somanassa indriyam ca adukkham asukhā vedanā upekkhā indriya
translated: Herein, pleasant feeling is two faculties, the pleasure faculty and the joy faculty. Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is the equanimity faculty.

analyzed: ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration by way of the faculties.

original: Tāniyeva indriyāni saṅkhārapariyāpannāni, ye saṅkhārā sāsavā bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: indriyāni saṅkhāra pariyāpannāni ye saṅkhārā sa āsavā bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: Those faculties are included in the determinations category, and the determinations that are subject to cankers and are the life-continuum are included in the mental-data base.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the penetration by way of the bases.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ sāsavaṁ bhavaṅgaṁ, ayaṁ āyatanehi otaraṇā.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam sa āsavam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: That mental-data base is included in the mental-data element and in the mind base, and the base that is subject to cankers and is the life-continuum is included in the mind base. This is the penetration by way of the bases.

original: “Anissitassa calitaṁ natthī”ti samathavasena vā taṇhāya anissito vipassanāvasena vā diṭṭhiyā anissito.
analyzed: anissitassa calitam natthi iti samatha vasena vā taṇhāya anissitaḥ vipassanā vasena vā diṭṭhiyā anissitaḥ
translated: “One who is not attached does not tremble” . He is not attached by craving through serenity or by view through insight.

original: Yā vipassanā ayaṁ vijjā, vijjuppādā avijjānirodho, avijjānirodhā saṅkhāranirodho, saṅkhāranirodhā viññāṇanirodho, evaṁ sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo.
analyzed: yā vipassanā ayam vijjā vijjuppādā avijjā nirodhaḥ avijjā nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodho saṅkhāra nirodhā viññāṇa nirodho evam sabbaḥ paṭiccasamuppādo
translated: This insight is the science. With the arising of the light there is the cessation of ignorance. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of formations. With the cessation of formations there is the cessation of consciousness. Thus the whole process of becoming.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the dependent origination.

analyzed: sā yā iva vipassanā paññākkhandho
translated: This insight is the understanding category.

analyzed: ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the categories.

analyzed: sāyā iva vipassanā dve indriyāni
translated: This insight is two faculties:

analyzed: vīriya indriyam ca paññindriyam ca
translated: the energy faculty and the understanding faculty.

analyzed: ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the faculties.

original: Sāyeva vipassanā saṅkhārapariyāpannā, ye saṅkhārā anāsavā, no ca bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: sā yā iva vipassanā saṅkhāra pariyāpannā ye saṅkhārāḥ anāsavāḥ no ca bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: This insight is included in formations. Those formations are not subject to cankers, and they are not the life-continuum. They are included in the mental-data base.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the penetration of the bases.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ anāsavaṁ, no ca bhavaṅgaṁ.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam anāsava no ca
translated: That mental-data base is included in the mental-data base. That base is not subject to cankers, and it is not the life-continuum.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the bases.

original: “Passaddhiyā satī”ti duvidhā passaddhi kāyikā ca cetasikā ca.
analyzed: passaddhiyā satīti duvidhā passaddhi kāyikā ca cetasikā ca
translated: “When there is tranquillity” : there is twofold tranquillity, bodily and mental.

analyzed: yam kāyikam sukha ayam kāya passaddhi
translated: That which is bodily pleasure is bodily tranquillity.

original: Yaṁ cetasikaṁ sukhaṁ, ayaṁ cetasikā passaddhi.
analyzed: yam cetasikam cetasikā
translated: And whatever mental pleasure there is, that is mental tranquillity.

original: Passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati, samāhito yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: passaddha kāyaḥ sukham sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati samāhitaḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: When the body is tranquil, one feels pleasure. When one feels pleasure, the mind becomes concentrated. When the mind is concentrated, one understands as it really is.

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānanto nibbindati, nibbindanto virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṁ🔽“vimuttam”iti ñāṇaṁ hoti, “khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānantaḥ nibbindati nibbindantaḥ virajjati virāgāḥ vimuccati vimuttasmi  vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti khīṇā jāti vusitam
translated: When one understands as it really is, one becomes dispassionate. When one is dispassionate, one loses interest. When one loses interest, one is liberated.

analyzed: itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: When one is liberated, one knows that one is liberated. One understands: ‘Birth is exhausted, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: So na namati rūpesu, na saddesu, na gandhesu, na rasesu, na phoṭṭhabbesu, na dhammesu🔽khayā rāgassa khayā dosassa khayā mohassa yena rūpena tathāgataṁ tiṭṭhantaṁ carantaṁ🔽paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya, tassa rūpassa khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā rūpasaṅkhaye
analyzed: so na namati rūpesu na saddesu na gandhesu na rasesu na phoṭṭhabbesu na dhammesu  khayā rāgassa khayā dosassa khayā mohassa yena rūpena tathāgatam tiṭṭhantam caranta  paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya tassa rūpassa khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā rūpa saṅkhaye
translated: He does not incline to form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or mental objects.🔽With the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion, the form by which the Tathāgata might be described would be destroyed, would fade away, would cease, would let go, would be relinquished.

original: vimutto, tathāgato atthītipi na upeti, natthītipi na upeti, atthi natthītipi na upeti,
analyzed: vimuttaḥ tathāgataḥ atthi itipi na upeti natthi itipi na upeti atthi natthi itipi na upeti
translated: Liberated by the destruction of form, the Tathāgata is not reckoned as: ‘He exists,’ or ‘He does not exist,’ or ‘He both exists and does not exist,’ or ‘He neither exists nor does not exist.’

analyzed: na iva atthi no natthi iti pi na upeti
translated: nor does it apply that it neither exists nor does not exist.

original: Atha kho gambhīro appameyyo asaṅkheyyo nibbutotiyeva saṅkhaṁ gacchati khayā rāgassa, khayā dosassa, khayā mohassa.🔽Yāya vedanāya …pe…
analyzed: atha kho gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ asaṅkheyyaḥ nibbuta utiyā iva saṅkham gacchati khayā rāgassa khayā dosassa khayā mohassa  yāya vedanāya pe
translated: It is reckoned as deep, immeasurable, incalculable, and tranquil, with the destruction of greed, the destruction of hatred, the destruction of delusion.🔽With whatever feeling …

analyzed: yāya saññāya
translated: with whatever perception …

analyzed: yehi saṅkhārehi
translated: with whatever volitional formations …

original: Yena viññāṇena tathāgataṁ tiṭṭhantaṁ carantaṁ paññāpayamāno paññāpeyya, tassa viññāṇassa
analyzed: yena viññāṇena tathāgatam tiṭṭhantam carantam paññāpayamānaḥ paññāpeyya tassa viññāṇassa
translated: with whatever consciousness a Tathāgata might exist and be conceived—

original: khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā viññāṇasaṅkhaye vimutto, tathāgato atthītipi
analyzed: khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā viññāṇa saṅkhaye vimuttaḥ tathāgataḥ atthi iti pi
translated: with the destruction, fading away, cessation, giving up, and relinquishing of that consciousness, the Tathāgata is freed through not clinging.🔽It does not apply that he exists,🔽nor does it apply that he does not exist,🔽nor that he both exists and does not exist,

original: na upeti, natthītipi na upeti, atthi natthītipi na upeti, nevatthi no natthītipi na upeti.
analyzed: na upeti natthi itipi na upeti atthi natthi itipi na upeti na iva atthi no natthi itipi na upeti
translated: nor that he neither exists nor does not exist.

original: Atha kho gambhīro appameyyo asaṅkheyyo nibbutotiyeva saṅkhaṁ gacchati khayā rāgassa, khayā dosassa, khayā mohassa.🔽“Āgatī”ti idhāgati.
analyzed: atha kho gambhīraḥ appameyyaḥ asaṅkheyyaḥ nibbuta utiyā iva saṅkham gacchati khayā rāgassa khayā dosassa khayā mohassa  āgati iti idha āgati
translated: It is reckoned as deep, immeasurable, incalculable, and tranquil, with the destruction of greed, the destruction of hatred, the destruction of delusion.🔽“Coming” is coming here.

analyzed: gati iti pa id ca bhavaḥ
translated: “Going” is a future state.

original: Āgatigatīpi na bhavanti, “nevidhā”ti chasu ajjhattikesu āyatanesu.
analyzed: na bhavanti chasu ajjhattikesu āyatanesu
translated: “Neither coming nor going” is not in the six internal sense spheres.

analyzed: na huranti chasu bāhiresu āyatanesu
translated: “No human being”: in the six external bases.

original: “Na ubhayamantarenā”ti phassasamuditesu dhammesu attānaṁ na passati.
analyzed: na ubhayam antarena ati phassa samuditesu dhammesu attānam na passati
translated: “Nor between the two”: he does not see himself in the things produced by contact.

analyzed: esevantaḥ dukkhassa ti paṭiccasamuppādaḥ
translated: “This is the end of suffering”: dependent origination.

original: So duvidho lokiyo ca lokuttaro ca.
analyzed: saḥ duvidhaḥ lokiyaḥ ca lokuttaraḥ ca
translated: It is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: Tattha lokiyo avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, yāva jarāmaraṇā.
analyzed: tattha lokiyaḥ avijjā paccayā saṅkhārāḥ yāva jarā maraṇā
translated: Herein, the mundane is ignorance as condition for volitional formations, up to old age and death.

original: Lokuttaro sīlavato avippaṭisāro jāyati, yāva nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāti.
analyzed: lokuttaraḥ sīlavataḥ a vippaṭisāraḥ jāyati yāva na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: The supramundane is that when a virtuous man there arises non-remorse, up to he understands: “There is no more of this mundane state.”

original: Tenāha bhagavā “nissitassa calitaṁ anissitassa calitaṁ natthi …pe…
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā nissitassa calitam anissitassa calitam natthi pe
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “For one who is dependent there is wavering, for one independent there is no wavering. …

analyzed: esevantaḥ dukkhassa ati
translated: This is the end of suffering” .

analyzed: ye keci sokā paridevitā vā
translated: Whatever griefs and lamentations,

analyzed: dukkhā ca lokasmim aneka rūpā  piyam paṭiccappabhavanti ete
translated: And the manifold sufferings in the world,🔽All these things have their source in love;

analyzed: piye asante na bhavanti ete
translated: When there is no love, they do not arise.

analyzed: tasmai hi te sukhinaḥ vīta sokā
translated: Therefore, happy and griefless are they

analyzed: yesam piyam na atthi kuhiñci loke
translated: Who have no loved ones anywhere in the world;

analyzed: tasmai asokam virajam patthayānaḥ
translated: Therefore, one who seeks the griefless, dustless state

analyzed: piyam na kayirātha kuhiñci loka iti
translated: Should not form love for anything in the world.

original: “Ye keci sokā paridevitā vā, dukkhā ca lokasmimanekarūpā piyaṁ paṭiccappabhavanti ete”ti—
analyzed: ye keci paridevitā vā dukkhā ca lokasmim aneka rūpā piyam paṭicca ppabhavanti ete iti
translated: “Whatever griefs and lamentations, Whatever suffering there is in the world, all arise because of one who is dear.”

analyzed: ayam dukkhā vedanā
translated: This is painful feeling.

analyzed: piye asante na bhavanti eta iti
translated: “When there is no one who is dear, these do not occur.”

analyzed: ayam sukhā vedanā
translated: This is pleasant feeling.

analyzed: vedanā vedanā khandhaḥ
translated: Feeling is the feeling aggregate.

analyzed: ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: This is how to descend into the pṇodes by way of the aggregates.

original: Vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṁ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ, evaṁ sabbaṁ.
analyzed: vedanā paccayā taṇhā taṇhā paccayā upādāna upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa evam sabba
translated: With feeling as condition: craving. With craving as condition: attachment. With attachment as condition: continuation. With continuation as condition: birth. With birth as condition: old age, death,

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is how to descend into the pṇodes by way of dependent origination.

analyzed: sukhā vedanā dve indriyāni
translated: Herein, pleasant feeling is two faculties:

analyzed: sukha indriyam somanassindriyam ca
translated: the pleasure faculty and the joy faculty.

analyzed: dukkhā vedanā dve indriyāni
translated: Painful feeling is two faculties:

original: dukkhindriyaṁ domanassindriyañca.🔽Ayaṁ indriyehi otaraṇā.🔽Tāniyeva indriyāni saṅkhārapariyāpannāni, ye saṅkhārā sāsavā bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: dukkha indriyam domanassa indriyam ca  ayam indriyehi otaraṇā  indriyāni saṅkhāra pariyāpannāni ye saṅkhārā sa āsavā bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: the pain faculty and the displeasure faculty.🔽This is how to descend into the pṇodes by way of the faculties.🔽Those faculties that are included in formations, which are contaminated and belong to the life-continuum, are included in the mental-data element.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is how to descend into the pṇodes by way of the elements.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ sāsavaṁ bhavaṅgaṁ.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam sa āsavam bhavaṅga
translated: This element of mental objects is included in the mental-object base, which is the contaminated life-continuum base.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the way of entry by way of the bases.

analyzed: tasmai hi te sukhinaḥ vīta sokā
translated: “Therefore, they are happy and griefless,

analyzed: yesam piyam na atthi kuhiñci loke
translated: Those who have no loved ones anywhere in the world.

analyzed: tasmai asokam virajam patthayānaḥ
translated: Therefore, one who seeks the griefless, the dust-free,

analyzed: piyam na kayirātha kuhiñci loka iti
translated: Should not make loved ones anywhere in the world.”

analyzed: idam taṇhā apahāna
translated: This is the abandoning of craving.

original: Taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, evaṁ sabbaṁ.
analyzed: taṇhā nirodhā upādāna nirodhaḥ upādāna nirodhā bhava nirodho evam sabba
translated: With the cessation of craving, there is the cessation of clinging; with the cessation of clinging, the cessation of existence; and so on.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā  tayā iva taṇhā apahānam
translated: This is the way of entry by way of dependent origination.🔽That same abandoning of craving is serenity.

original: So samatho dve indriyāni satindriyaṁ samādhindriyañca.
analyzed: saḥ dve indriyāni satindriyam samādhindriyam ca
translated: That serenity is the faculty of concentration and the faculty of mindfulness.

analyzed: ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the way of entry by way of the faculties.

analyzed: so yā iva samathaḥ samādhi kkhandho  ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: That same serenity is the concentration aggregate.🔽This is the way of entry by way of the aggregates.

original: Soyeva samatho saṅkhārapariyāpanno, ye saṅkhārā anāsavā, no ca bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: so yā iva samathaḥ saṅkhāra pariyāpanno ye saṅkhārāḥ anāsavāḥ no ca bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: That same serenity is included in formations, which are the formations that are not contaminants and are not the life-continuum, and which are included in the mental-object element.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the way of entry by way of the elements.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ anāsavaṁ, no ca bhavaṅgaṁ.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam anāsava no ca
translated: This element of ideas is included in the idea base, and that base is without-outcome but not life-continuum.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is how the Thread is entered by way of the bases.

original: Tenāha bhagavā “ye keci sokā”ti.🔽“Kāmaṁ kāmayamānassa,🔽tassa ce taṁ samijjhati;
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā ye  kāmam kāmayamānassa  tassa ce tam samijjhati
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Whatever sorrows” .🔽“When one who desires gets what he wants,🔽surely he is glad at heart,

analyzed: addhā pītimanaḥ hoti
translated: having got what he wanted,

original: laddhā macco yadicchati.🔽Tassa ce kāmayānassa,🔽chandajātassa jantuno;
analyzed: laddhā mad caḥ yat icchati  tassa ce kāmayānassa  chanda jātassa jantunaḥ
translated: the man who has his wish.🔽But when the man who wants and longs🔽for what he wants does not get it,

analyzed: te kāmā parihāyanti
translated: those desires of his desert him

analyzed: salla viddhaḥ uva ruppati
translated: as he lies there all a-quiver.

analyzed: yaḥ kāme parivajja iti
translated: He who avoids desires

analyzed: sappassa iva padā siraḥ  somam visattikam loke
translated: as a snake its poisoned foot,🔽the man who is mindful and aware

analyzed: sataḥ samativattati iti
translated: in the world overcomes sorrow” .

analyzed: tattha yā ayam anunayaḥ
translated: Herein, the gladness is approval.

analyzed: yat āha salla viddhaḥ uva ruppati iti idam paṭigha
translated: When it is said “as he lies there all a-quiver” , this is resistance.

original: Anunayaṁ paṭighañca pana taṇhāpakkho, taṇhāya ca pana dasarūpīni āyatanāni padaṭṭhānaṁ.
analyzed: anunayam paṭigham ca pana taṇhā pakkhaḥ taṇhāya ca pana dasarūpīni āyatanāni padaṭṭhāna
translated: But approval and resistance are on the side of craving, and the ten form bases are the footing for craving.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is how the Thread is entered by way of the bases.

original: Tāniyeva dasa rūpīni rūpakāyo nāmasampayutto, tadubhayaṁ nāmarūpaṁ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanaṁ, saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, evaṁ sabbaṁ.
analyzed: dasa rūpīni rūpa kāyaḥ nāma sampayuttaḥ tad ubhayam nāma rūpa nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatana saḷāyatana paccayā phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā vedanā paccayā taṇhā evam sabba
translated: These same ten material instances are the material body, associated with mind. Both together are mentality-materiality. With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base. With the sixfold base as condition, contact. With contact as condition, feeling. With feeling as condition, craving. And so with the rest.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the way of entry by way of dependent origination.

analyzed: tat eva nāma rūpam pañca kkhandhaḥ  ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: That same mentality-materiality is the five aggregates.🔽This is the way of entry by way of the aggregates.

analyzed: tat eva nāma rūpam aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ
translated: That same mentality-materiality is the eighteen elements.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the way of entry by way of the elements.

original: Tattha yo rūpakāyo imāni pañca rūpīni indriyāni, yo nāmakāyo imāni pañca arūpīni indriyāni, imāni dasa indriyāni.
analyzed: tattha yaḥ rūpa kāyaḥ imāni pañca rūpīni indriyāni yaḥ nāma kāyaḥ imāni pañca arūpīni indriyāni imāni dasa indriyāni
translated: Herein, the material body is the five material faculties, and the mental body is the five immaterial faculties. These are the ten faculties.

analyzed: ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the way of entry by way of the faculties.

analyzed: tat tha yat āha
translated: Herein, it is said:

analyzed: yaḥ kāme parivajja iti
translated: “He who avoids sense desires,

analyzed: sappassa iva padā siraḥ
translated: Like a snake’s head, like poison,

analyzed: somam visattikam loke
translated: The lovely, tempting things of the world,

analyzed: sataḥ samativattati iti
translated: He, mindful, overcomes them all” .

original: Ayaṁ saupādisesā nibbānadhātu, ayaṁ dhātūhi otaraṇā.
analyzed: ayam sa aupādisesā nibbāna dhātu ayam dhātūhi otaraṇā
translated: This is the element of extinction with trace left. This is the way of entry by way of the elements.

original: Sāyeva saupādisesā nibbānadhātu vijjā, vijjuppādā avijjānirodho, avijjānirodhā saṅkhāranirodho, evaṁ sabbaṁ.
analyzed: sā āyā iva sa aupādisesā nibbāna dhātu vijjā vijjuppādā avijjā nirodhaḥ avijjā nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodhaḥ evam sabba
translated: That same Nibbāna element with residue left is knowledge. With the arising of knowledge there is the cessation of ignorance, with the cessation of ignorance the cessation of formations, and so on.

analyzed: ayam paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the dependent origination.

analyzed: sāya iva vijjā paññākkhandho
translated: That same knowledge is the understanding category.

analyzed: ayam khandhehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the categories.

analyzed: sāyā iva vijjā dve indriyāni
translated: That same knowledge is two faculties,

analyzed: vīriya indriyam paññindriyam ca
translated: the energy faculty and the understanding faculty.

analyzed: ayam indriyehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the faculties.

original: Sāyeva vijjā saṅkhārapariyāpannā, ye saṅkhārā anāsavā, no ca bhavaṅgā, te saṅkhārā dhammadhātusaṅgahitā.
analyzed: sāyā iva vijjā saṅkhāra pariyāpannā ye saṅkhārāḥ anāsavāḥ no ca bhavaṅgā te saṅkhārāḥ dhammadhātu saṅgahitā
translated: That same knowledge is included in formations, those formations that are free from cankers and are not in the life-continuum are included in the mental-data base.

analyzed: ayam
translated: This is the penetration of the bases.

original: Sā dhammadhātu dhammāyatanapariyāpannā, yaṁ āyatanaṁ anāsavaṁ, no ca bhavaṅgaṁ.
analyzed: sā dhammadhātu dhamma āyatana pariyāpannā yam āyatanam anāsava no ca
translated: That mental-data base is included in the mental-data element, that element which is free from cankers and is not in the life-continuum.

analyzed: ayam āyatanehi otaraṇā
translated: This is the penetration of the elements.

original: Tenāha bhagavā “kāmaṁ kāmayamānassā”ti.🔽Ettāvatā paṭicca indriyakhandhadhātuāyatanāni samosaraṇotaraṇāni bhavanti.
analyzed: tena āha bhagavā kāmam kāmayamānaḥ sa ati  ettāvatā paṭicca indriya khandha dhātu āyatanāni samosaraṇa utaraṇāni bhavanti
translated: That is why the Blessed One said: “One who is desirous of sensual desires” .🔽Thus the faculties, categories, elements, and bases are brought together and penetrated up to this point.

analyzed: evam paṭicca indriya khandha dhātu āyatanāni otāretabbāni
translated: This is how the faculties, categories, elements, and bases should be penetrated.

analyzed: tena āha āyasmā mahākaccāyanaḥ yaḥ ca paṭiccuppādaḥ ti
translated: Hence the venerable Maha Kaccana said: “The arising of the dependent origination” .

analyzed: niyuttaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāraḥ
translated: The mode of Conveying a Conversion is the Conversion of Relinquishment.
